title: (x) Geometric sans caps w/ weird R - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {J Edward Sanchez}
content:
Could anyone help identify this font? Notice the weird R.

Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fontfull.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133539/http:/typophile.com/files/fontfull.jpg) | 76.35 KB |

 [‹ New Look Cochin](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133539/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44965 "Go to previous forum topic") [WHAT'S THIS FONT?!? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133539/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45344 "Go to next forum topic")
author: instereo

comments.content:
Thank you very much.

WhatTheFont isn’t very reliable in some cases, I guess.

_WhatTheFont isn’t very reliable in some cases, I guess._

All tools have their weaknesses, starting with their databases and then the coding. A group of experts will beat any tool for font identification.

- Mike Yanega

And a group of experts can benefit a lot from such tools.

Andrew, cropping your image so that all characters are on _one_ line and are either positive _or_ negative will help WTF to give the correct answer:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133539im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/wtf_3912.png)

Florian, I don’t disagree that tools can be helpful, but I stand by the claim that a group of experts can beat any tool at font identification.

- Mike Yanega

Mike, I am at one with you. Just wanted to demonstrate that, in this case, WTF would have been capable of coming up with the right answer. Yes, it’s a stupid machine, you have to know how to feed it.  
F

Yes, it was a good point about tailoring the image to fit the tool. It also shows another tool limitation that doesn’t bother a human. I’m really not trying to prolong an argument, because I think we are in agreement, but I often hear newcomers talk about these tools as if they are all you need to ID fonts. My comments were mostly to illustrate why that approach is often frustrating.

- Mike Yanega
